Text:
The next big risk looming over our banks? The commercial real estate market.
We have to make sure banks and lenders play their part in hedging an impending crisis. I'll be watching closely.
https://t.co/db0jJfUCRI

No billionaire is above the law, but Elon Musk sure loves to act like he is. Since taking over Twitter, he’s run the company with little regard for consumer privacy and safety, potentially violating legal obligations.

I'm demanding answers.
https://t.co/YvXTLY11Al

As Republican legislators across the country pass new anti-LGBTQ laws, they stoke fear, confusion and hateful sentiment along the way. We have to stay vigilant in this fight—and remember that the fight for full equality is far from over. https://t.co/UYXPOaGJpx

Did you know that rogue nations, oligarchs, and drug lords use crypto to launder billions in stolen funds, evade sanctions, and finance terrorism? It’s a big problem, but one we can fix.

I have a bill that will close loopholes and apply common-sense rules to the industry.

You should know: Senate Republicans just fought to block President Biden’s plan to deliver student debt relief to 43 million borrowers. You better believe I voted against it.

I’m going to keep fighting for this.
Time and time again, Congressional Republicans show us that they’d much rather help giant corporations than working people. I’m done being surprised, but I’m not done fighting to stop them.
Eh, no thanks.

#Pride month is a celebration of hard-won progress for LGBTQ+ rights. It's also a chance to renew our commitment to fight like hell for equality.

With hateful new laws passing across the country, we must fight until everyone can live proudly & safely as themselves—without fear.

Congressional Republicans believe in an America that says ‘I’ve got mine, the rest of you are on your own.’ But this doesn’t apply to their rich buddies. They push tax breaks for billionaires while slashing programs that help working people.
I’m keeping up the fight to push back against these new and baseless threats to abortion medication. https://t.co/zsbHIskk14
I’m asking the @USChamber why they’re cheerleading Republicans’ proposed spending cuts to critical programs — while also supporting proposed tax cuts for wealthy corporations. This is hypocritical.

Right now, House Republicans are demanding we pinch pennies on programs like food assistance & health care for families.

Next month, they want to roll out a plan that hands trillions in tax cuts to big corporations & the wealthy. This is not fiscal responsibility. It’s cruelty.
Price gouging is a problem across our economy, and the defense industry is no exception. I’ve got a bill to fight back against these rip-offs with basic rules of the road.

My three big brothers all served in the military. My mother and I would wait by the mailbox to hear from them—days with letters were extra sunny. They made it home safely, but many service members do not. We honor those service members’ sacrifices on #MemorialDay and every day.
I’m staying in the fight for federal funding to replace the Cape Cod Bridges. https://t.co/kYu4gN3WlX

During #AAPIHeritageMonth, I’m glad to work with my colleagues to recognize AAPI leaders like Caroline Chang, who fought hard to make life better for people across the Commonwealth and the country. Let’s get this done. https://t.co/BYyOf6yghV
A billionaire shouldn’t be able to pay less in taxes than a Boston public school teacher. (Yes, Jeff Bezos, I’m looking at you.)

Do we want a government that works great for student loan servicing companies, or do we want a government that looks out for people whose families can’t write big tuition checks? House Republicans have made their priorities clear.
https://t.co/bqiKl1oQKL

We’ve got a chance to strengthen the Federal Reserve’s oversight and accountability, eliminate conflicts of interest, and make this institution work better for the American people. And we must seize it. It’s time to end the Fed’s culture of corruption.
https://t.co/ObxDJDOWH3
But no billionaire would have to pitch in another penny. Shameful. I’ll keep fighting back. https://t.co/ZAnfvJzcMV

George Floyd should still be alive. I’m praying for his loved ones as they carry the weight of today’s anniversary of his murder. And I’ll continue working for structural change to dismantle systemic racism and cement the unshakeable truth that Black Lives Matter.

Free ideas to reduce the deficit without imposing pain on working people (cc House Republicans):
✔️ Put a minimum tax on billionaires
✔️ Stitch up corporate tax loopholes
✔️ Beef up taxes on CEO-pay-juicing stock buybacks
✔️ Repeal Trump’s giveaways to the wealthy

One year ago today, Uvalde joined a list of places whose names are synonymous with senseless loss. Columbine. Sandy Hook. Charleston. Pulse. El Paso.

Enough is enough is enough is enough.

I won’t stop working to pass commonsense reform and protect our people from gun violence.
Let’s call this what it is: a backdoor bailout. https://t.co/NwrWhoHnbf

Nearly 90% of President Biden’s student debt cancelation plan would go to people earning less than $75,000 a year.

But the GOP would rather have our government on the side of billionaires, not working families, so they’re trying to rip away this relief.

I’m fighting back.

Congressional Republicans pinch pennies on food assistance and health care for families, but money is no object to them when it comes to giveaways for ultra-rich tax cheats, massively profitable corporations, and price-gouging defense contractors.

Billionaire CEOs and giant corporations laugh all the way to the bank after exploiting every tax loophole in the book. So if Republicans were serious about reducing the deficit—instead of just inflicting pain on working people—that’s where they’d start.
Good riddance to a price-hiking scheme. The Biden-Harris administration and Massachusetts’ @AndreaForAG fought back and won for consumers. https://t.co/eaohHuI6HA
Here’s how we won a crackdown on wealthy tax cheats and made progress towards fast, free tax filing for all Americans: https://t.co/L89M1FtsMw
Guess what? The nation’s biggest bank—already too big to fail—got a bargain deal on a failing bank that made it even bigger. I’m deeply troubled and calling for answers. https://t.co/PYX6J1exLj
Understand this: the House GOP has shown that they’d rather take food and health care away from people who are struggling than take $1 more in taxes from a billionaire.

If you’re enjoying your weekend, thank the labor movement.

And if you’re winding down with a movie or TV show, thank the working people who create the stories we love.

I stand with @WGAWest, @WGAEast, @SAGAFTRA, and #DGA in their fight.

Republicans in Congress are threatening to push our nation off an economic cliff, throw millions of Americans out of work, and destroy our good name around the world if they don’t get their way on the budget. That isn’t negotiating—that’s hostage-taking, pure and simple.

“The validity of the public debt of the United States…shall not be questioned.” That’s from the 14th Amendment. It gives the president the authority to make sure the U.S. keeps paying the bills. If Republicans won’t stop holding our economy hostage, he should be ready to use it.

CEOs made tens of millions for driving Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank into the ground. They told me they won’t return a single nickel. So I’ve got a bipartisan bill to make that decision for failed bank executives and claw back their compensation. https://t.co/X62FYLPSnK

With every new radical ruling and every new ethics scandal, the Supreme Court faces more and more of a legitimacy crisis. We must #ExpandTheCourt to rebalance it, and we must institute a binding code of ethics for the justices.
Here’s how we can fight back against conflicts of interest and strengthen accountability at the Federal Reserve: https://t.co/hBcl1DnFy6

Make no mistake: this is what Republican extremists want to do all around the country. I won’t stop fighting for a national law codifying the right to an abortion so we can sweep all these horrific bans off the books. https://t.co/i1zaV6XQ7Q
I’ve got a bipartisan bill which basically says this to bank executives: you can’t take on a ton of risk, pay yourselves a ton of money, and expect to keep that money when you blow up your bank.

Tax filing should be free—not an opportunity for giant corporations to make big bucks. That’s why I’ve been in this fight for years. And when we stay in the fight, we make progress.
https://t.co/9f0rQGcE53

In 2019, a government watchdog found the Pentagon’s 14 largest contractors had hired 1,700 former senior Pentagon officials. That’s an entire small town—and the vast majority came from jobs managing contracts.

Let’s slap a padlock on this revolving door.
https://t.co/36Z9eGKAf7

The last time Silicon Valley Bank’s CEO testified to the Senate Banking Committee, he was lobbying for looser regulations.

Today, he came back to talk about how his bank had failed—under weaker oversight.

I’m fighting to put strong protections in place and prevent more crashes.
Woo-hoo, @REIUnionBoston! When working people fight, working people win—and every victory inspires more people to get in the ring.
Vast majorities of Democrats, Independents, AND Republicans support my plan to put child care within reach for every family. Now let’s make it happen. https://t.co/1P6EN7N4pY

After years of fighting for reform, and after calling out Betsy DeVos for standing in the way of this, I’m very happy to see these teachers, nurses, & other public servants finally benefiting from student debt cancelation under the president’s leadership.
https://t.co/h8Ica2Bqu8

The GOP's budget plans boil down to a basic idea: making government work better for the rich and powerful and worse for everyone else. That’s why they push tax breaks for billionaires, coddle wealthy tax cheats, and try to slash programs for working people. I’m fighting back.
There are commonsense steps we as a nation can—and must—take to reduce gun violence. I’m going to stay on this—including working to ban assault weapons.

My daddy couldn’t work for a while after he had a heart attack. Bills piled up. One day, when I walked into my parents’ bedroom, I saw my mother’s face was red & puffy. A dress was laid out over the bedspread—the dress that only came out for weddings, graduations, & funerals:

Defaulting on the national debt is not an option. Congressional Republicans already decided to swell the deficit when they gave massive tax breaks to billionaires and giant corporations. They don’t get to turn around now and say they won’t pay the bill.

The SAFE Banking Act is a long overdue step, and we can’t stop there. We’ve got to legalize marijuana, expunge criminal records, and address decades of harmful and racially discriminatory cannabis laws.
https://t.co/VW9P5mGKh5
Let's do this @REIUnionBoston! I'm with you all the way in your righteous fight for dignity and a voice at your workplace. Stay strong!
This extreme obstruction has now been called out by the Secretary of Defense and a leader of the senator's own party. It's got to stop. https://t.co/knitQ3ONff

You can’t run an economy without roads or bridges. And you can’t run an economy without child care. We can make this system work for kids, families, and child care workers with a national investment—and that’s what I’m fighting for. https://t.co/vUbEp5vJQM

Big bank CEOs have been able to load up on risk, boost short-term profits, and walk away with ginormous amounts of money even when their banks fail. Instead of incentivizing recklessness, let’s pass my bipartisan bill to claw back executive compensation after bank failures.
If Congressional Republicans are actually serious about reducing the national debt, then let’s talk about getting billionaires and giant corporations to pay their fair share.

If someone misses a credit card payment—even just by a few hours—they could get slapped with a late fee up to 5X bigger than the actual cost to the company. Now lobbyists are trying to stop the CFPB from fighting back. Let’s get some answers. https://t.co/BAzzgLSQzH

Service members who aren’t getting pay increases they earned.
Kids who can’t start at new schools.
Spouses who can’t take new jobs.

Secretary Austin’s response to my letter shows the human consequences & national security stakes of this hostage-taking. https://t.co/mt1YkfHmiL
Universal child care would support working families, grow our whole economy, and help build a future for all of our kids. I’m staying in the fight to make it happen.

I’m very happy to join the Advisory Board for @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris’ re-election campaign! Let’s do everything we can to keep them in the White House so they can keep protecting our freedoms, defending our democracy, and putting our government on the side of working people.

First, you identify the problem. Then, you fight to fix it—for as long as it takes. Take a look at this timeline of how I’ve been working—and will continue to work—to deliver relief to people getting crushed by student debt:
Banking should be boring—not a thrill-seeking industry where CEOs can gamble with our whole economy.

Giant corporations don’t want us talking about their price gouging. But working families sure are feeling it. I’ve got a bill—the Price Gouging Prevention Act—to crack down on corporate profiteering. And I’ll keep fighting for our government to use every tool to bring down costs.

When we elect more moms, the conversations in the halls of power start to change. There’s more talk about child care. More talk about paid leave. More talk about how we make our country work for families. That’s why @VoteMamaFdn’s work is powerfully important.
Two words for executives whose actions have led directly to a bank failure: pay up. https://t.co/pWVvvve2vs
Justice Clarence Thomas’ pattern of unethical conduct couldn’t be clearer. The Supreme Court needs an enforceable code of ethics. If they won’t act, Congress must.

Why are big banks dropping like flies? Well, under the Trump administration, their executives successfully lobbied for looser regulations, which let them juice profits by loading up on risk—until it all came tumbling down. I’m fighting for accountability and reform.

12.7 million new jobs under the Biden-Harris administration.
Unemployment at a 54-year low.
The lowest-ever Black unemployment rate.
There’s more work to do, but this is what it looks like to have a government on the side of working people.
I think this is pretty basic, but apparently it’s breaking news to a lot of powerful people: Supreme Court justices should have to follow a binding code of ethics.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall—and American taxpayers would be on the hook. https://t.co/aSTj3zqnUt

The Biden-Harris administration is trying to put trade policy on the side of working families, not giant corporations. But corporate lobbyists are still working to undermine the president’s agenda behind closed doors. I released a report raising the alarm: https://t.co/42fIp0DcP1

The MAGA GOP House passed a bill to...
☑️ Throw hundreds of thousands of Americans out of work
☑️ Protect wealthy tax cheats
☑️ Block student debt relief
And that’s just the tip of the ugly iceberg. It would coddle the rich & punch working people in the gut. It’s a non-starter.
I remember exactly where I was when I got the news about the draft opinion overturning Roe. I shared that story and talked about the path ahead to protect abortion rights: https://t.co/PGoAaLojxy
Most federal judges are bound by a code of ethics. But there are nine exceptions: the nine justices on the Supreme Court. My Judicial Ethics and Anti-Corruption Act would close that loophole.

One year ago tonight, we saw the draft opinion overturning Roe. The next day, I spoke out at the Supreme Court. And over the next year, from the ballot box to the halls of power, the American people made their voices heard. I’ll keep fighting to secure abortion rights nationwide.

If bank executives load up on risk and succeed, they get rich. If they load up on risk and fail, they still get rich, even if they tank the whole economy. So let’s change those incentives. Let’s pass my bipartisan bill to claw back executive pay and bonuses after bank failures.

The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office has tools it can—and must—use to bring down the cost of prescription drugs. Here’s how:
https://t.co/7UYWwTb6Bj

How many more big banks have to fail before Congress finally passes major reforms? I’m staying in the fight for the strong rules our banking system needs.
https://t.co/eHUIaWIWJZ

Happy #InternationalWorkersDay to all the working people fighting for an economy that works for everyone—not just a thin slice at the top. Unions built America’s middle class, and unions will rebuild America’s middle class.
The birthday boy gets a burrito https://t.co/aRg6R2JhCx

If nearly 90% of a relief plan went to billionaires and giant corporations, GOP politicians would put on a parade for it. But because nearly 90% of President Biden’s student debt cancelation plan is for people earning less than $75,000, Republicans are mobilizing to block it.

Credit reporting agencies turn bad data into real pain for American consumers—like getting rental applications denied, paying more for car loans, or even missing out on new jobs. I’ll keep telling that to these CEOs’ faces and calling for reform.
https://t.co/xR1CTIrtmF

Centuries of structural racism have created deep disparities in health outcomes for Black and Brown communities. The Anti-Racism in Public Health Act will finally tackle these disparities head-on and declare racism the public health crisis that it is. https://t.co/inTMUgeYBn

I grew up in Oklahoma before Roe, and I’m horrified to see what’s happening after Roe. Right-wing extremists are risking women’s lives and safety. I’ll keep fighting to ensure the right to an abortion nationwide. https://t.co/o2QBdpafF2

It’s long past time to put a padlock on the revolving door between the Pentagon and the defense industry. I’ll keep fighting for my legislation to rein in influence peddling there and across our government. https://t.co/r5wufT6Cjl

“Women shall have equal rights in the [U.S.] & every place subject to its jurisdiction. Equality of rights under the law shall not be denied or abridged by the [U.S.] or by any State on account of sex.”

Senate Republicans just voted to block that from going in the Constitution.

I’m fighting to make our government work for people trying to fill their prescriptions, not Big Pharma. For students finishing their education, not student loan servicers. For small businesses getting off the ground, not big monopolies. For everyone, not just the rich & powerful.
A non-serious non-starter. https://t.co/0hZvRYQrBC

It’s no secret I disagree with a lot of policy decisions from the Pentagon. But a policy disagreement isn’t a reason to indefinitely block ALL senior military nominations and promotions—holding up pay increases and jeopardizing our national security.
https://t.co/D07quxUFjT

No one should have to wonder whether a Supreme Court justice who heard their case ignored the law because his wife had a stake in the outcome—or because his friend, who took him on a half-million-dollar vacation, wanted him to rule a certain way. https://t.co/25cgJMVBsU

The federal judiciary needs structural ethics reform, all the way up to the Supreme Court. (Yes, Justice Clarence Thomas, I’m looking at you.) I’ve got a bill for that, and I’m going to keep fighting to root corruption out of Washington.

In 2020, in the middle of a pandemic, the American people turned out in record numbers to elect @JoeBiden & @KamalaHarris. Under their leadership:
✅ 12 million new jobs
✅ Historic investment in fighting climate change
✅ Insulin capped at $35/month for seniors
And much more.

President @JoeBiden and Vice President @KamalaHarris are in this fight to protect our freedoms, defend our democracy, and put our government on the side of working people. It’s time to do everything we can to make sure they stay in the White House. Let’s finish the job!

The GOP loves lining the pockets of billionaires & giant corporations. But they take to their fainting couches if anyone tries to spend money helping working people. So no wonder they hate @JoeBiden’s student debt cancelation plan—nearly 90% is for people making under $75,000.

Another week where mifepristone remains legal.

I’m fighting to keep it that way.

I’ll just be blunt: right-wing extremists have hijacked the Supreme Court of the United States. From shredding abortion rights to rigging the rules against workers and consumers, an out-of-touch majority is substituting their own views for the rule of law.

Tomorrow, @EdMarkey, @AyannaPressley, and I will help kick off a new campaign with a growing coalition calling for Supreme Court reform. The principle of Equal Justice Under Law depends on us taking action. https://t.co/YJcjFe6TsV

This year’s #EarthDay, we can recognize the progress we’ve made while recommitting to the fight ahead. Last year, we passed the biggest climate bill in history, funded in part by my plan for a corporate minimum tax. And I’ll keep fighting to protect our planet.

The House GOP is demanding job-destroying budget cuts in exchange for avoiding a job-destroying debt default. In other words: Heads they win, tails the working people of America lose. It’s a non-starter, and I’m holding firm for a clean bill to prevent a debt ceiling crisis.
Wishing a joyous Eid al-Fitr to all Muslims celebrating in Massachusetts and around the world. Eid Mubarak!

Surprise, surprise: corporate lobbyists are scurrying around trying to weaken a pro-worker policy. This time, it’s one that would ban non-compete clauses. We’re calling on the FTC to stand strong and protect as many working people as possible. https://t.co/HEtm9fMYpE

After the Supreme Court overturned Roe, I called on the Department of Veterans Affairs to start offering abortion care, and they’re stepping up to the plate. Republican extremists will keep coming after our freedoms, but I’ll keep fighting back.
https://t.co/AeXYpdIbRY

When I first ran for Senate, I asked people in Roxbury and all over Massachusetts to take a chance on someone who’d never held elected office. I’m deeply grateful that they did, and I’m running for re-election to build on the progress we’ve made together. https://t.co/CFvzd5N9IC
Health care is a basic human right, and this is a critical and long-overdue step. I’ll keep fighting to deliver a pathway to citizenship and reform the immigration system. https://t.co/Sf1lwiCYsU

Executives shouldn’t be able to ride off into the sunset with big heaps of money after burning their banks to the ground. I’ve got a bipartisan bill to help regulators claw back executive compensation and bonuses after a place like Silicon Valley Bank collapses.

You know why House Republicans are manufacturing a debt ceiling crisis? To demand cuts that could throw hundreds of thousands of Americans out of work, AND to let corporations skip out on the bill at tax time. I’m going to keep fighting to stop their schemes.
I’ll keep working to improve housing conditions for military families and ensure their concerns are addressed, not silenced. https://t.co/RkRUJillAF
Here’s the way I see it: no one should get a tax break for owning a yacht or a private jet. https://t.co/JWcsQJPUpW

I want to share a quick #TaxDay story that shows how we can make real change.

55 corporations all together made tens of billions of dollars in 2020 profits, bragged to their shareholders about all that money, and paid $0 in federal income taxes. You read that right—zero.

If you’re paying any federal income taxes this year—any at all—you’re funding our country more than this billionaire did in 2007 or 2011. It’s time for the rich and powerful to pay their fair share, and that includes a #WealthTax on fortunes greater than $50 million. https://t.co/MhFZpZBdNb

I fought for the CHIPS and Science Act because funding scientific research creates good new jobs and strengthens our national security. Visiting UMass Lowell, I got a glimpse of the innovation in our future, and it gave me goosebumps.
https://t.co/VxsQVGC3Fh
Have you been spending a lot of time and money filing your taxes? You’re not alone: the process takes Americans an average of 13 hours and $200. And here’s a big reason why—corporate greed:

Good luck to everyone running the #BostonMarathon today! One word: persist. A few more words: take inspiration from Sara Mae Berman, one of the first women to ever run this race. https://t.co/SbGxqTg9ML

Public trust in the Supreme Court has already hit historic lows. I won’t be surprised if it falls even lower now that we’re learning more about Justice Clarence Thomas’ undisclosed gifts from a GOP megadonor.

On the 10th anniversary of the Boston Marathon bombing, I’m thinking of the victims, survivors, and brave first responders. I encourage you to mark this anniversary by honoring #OneBostonDay with acts of service and kindness: https://t.co/eq7B8dmsrm

Appalling. It hasn’t taken effect yet, but let’s remember: six weeks is before many people even know that they’re pregnant. I’ll keep fighting to codify Roe v. Wade into federal law and sweep these abortion bans off the books.

As someone who believes in the power of the labor movement, and as someone who loves the beauty of the great outdoors, I stand with @REIUnionBoston. When working people come together, working people win.
I won’t stop working to keep our people safe from gun violence—and that includes passing a national ban on assault weapons.

When we work together, we make real change. It’s how we passed a new tax on giant corporations, used that revenue to support the biggest-ever climate package, and got student debt cancelation to President Biden’s desk. It’s how we can put government on the side of working people.

Thank you, Roxbury, for a great conversation on how we can make our government work for everyone, not just a thin slice at the top. And thank you to @Maura_Healey, @WuTrain, @AyannaPressley, and @Ruthzee for joining our Town Hall. https://t.co/oSSQGN72RT

If you’re angry about all the right-wing attacks on reproductive freedom, I’m right there with you. I’m staying in the fight for abortion rights, and I’m asking you to stay angry—to channel your anger into working towards change.
Woo-hoo! @TammyBaldwin knows how to fight and knows how to win. The working people of Wisconsin always have a champion in her. Let’s do everything we can to keep her voice in the Senate.

Not missing a beat.
https://t.co/49W0kt6sOw
Mifepristone is—and will remain—safe, legal, and available in Massachusetts. https://t.co/z63qP2Q9N6
Tomorrow evening’s the first Town Hall of our re-election campaign! RSVP here to join me, @Maura_Healey, @AyannaPressley, and @WuTrain in Roxbury: https://t.co/rRdSphJZVp

I never thought I would run for office. Ever. But the first time I ran, I learned that no candidate gets it done alone—and I’ve been honored to work alongside a grassroots team. Will you be a part of our re-election campaign? https://t.co/BZNTMK6Mpz
.@AOC and I are calling for answers about these mutual backscratching arrangements—and what role they played in Silicon Valley Bank’s failure. https://t.co/DWn7NWIKhm
Great news for Pennsylvania families—now let’s work to keep @Bob_Casey (and his maps) in the U.S. Senate.
Everyone—not just people who come from well-off families—should be able to continue their education after high school without getting crushed by debt.

Happy Easter Sunday to everyone celebrating! Each year, I always think of one of my favorite lessons I learned in Sunday school: By doing good and acting in service to one another, we can live a righteous life.

I hope you enjoy today with your family and loved ones.

We need to reform our budget models so that inaccurate math doesn’t take precedence over investments that will create long-term prosperity—like universal child care. Read more in my new Op-Ed: https://t.co/PT0jD9584o

If you look up “greed” in the dictionary, you should see SoFi’s logo. @AyannaPressley and I are calling them out and calling for answers on their cynical lawsuit. And we’ll keep fighting to fix the broken student loan system.
https://t.co/JWfN4Eulmm

Both @BrotherJones_ & @JustinJPearson can run for the seats they were just expelled from. Let’s show we have their backs & ensure they have the resources they need to win.

Please donate today if you can—100% of your contribution goes to their campaigns.
https://t.co/aXKIGsnTGA

This is not what democracy looks like. Shame on the Tennessee lawmakers who voted to expel two Black men from the legislature for speaking out about gun violence. I stand with @BrotherJones_ and @JustinJPearson.
https://t.co/JgLSvCHvYS

When someone gets their day in court, they shouldn’t have to wonder whether their judge—or a Supreme Court justice—is looking out for wealthy donors instead of the rule of law. I’ll keep fighting to root corruption out of our federal judiciary.
https://t.co/5ouMivDIM3

Next Wednesday, I’m hosting the first Town Hall of our re-election campaign—with special guests @Maura_Healey, @AyannaPressley, and @WuTrain. Will we see you in Roxbury? RSVP here: https://t.co/moteddh9CP

Workers at ActBlue have been an instrumental part of making big, structural change in campaigns across the country. I urge @ActBlue and @ActBlueUnion to reach a resolution that is fair and equitable for the workers.
Wishing a joyous Passover to Jewish families and communities in Massachusetts and around the world. Chag Sameach!
When we run on abortion rights, we win on abortion rights.
Woo-hoo, @JanetForJustice! Wisconsin voters made their voices heard, and I know you will protect our democracy as the state’s newest Supreme Court justice.

Congratulations, @Brandon4Chicago! Chicago will have a mayor that stands for the people, not entrenched special interests and political insiders. I’m thrilled to see what he does for the city’s public schools and beyond.

What’s happening in Tennessee is infuriating and anti-democratic. I stand with @brotherjones_, @VoteGloriaJ, @Justinjpearson, and the gun violence prevention advocates who are demanding action: https://t.co/Z2Qj0C3M3G

There are plenty of ways to make a real difference in an election. But if making a financial contribution would make sense for you right now, I’d be honored if you could become a Founding Donor for our re-election campaign today: https://t.co/B6hBswqwoC

Bank executives begged for weaker oversight rules. They got them. And then they reaped what they sowed. I’m fighting to protect working people from any more bank failures by putting strong protections back in place. https://t.co/ePobGDMQgO

When someone finds out they’re pregnant and needs to decide what to do, they should be able to consult with anyone they want—their partner, a parent, a friend, anyone. But you know who shouldn’t put themselves in the middle of that decision? The government.

If the laws that we have in Massachusetts were the laws all across this country, we would reduce deaths from gun violence dramatically. I have a comprehensive bill to achieve that goal, and I’m going to keep working on this every way I can. https://t.co/uXA4CWUXUq

Families shouldn’t pay the price for out-of-control corporate greed. I’ve been calling for answers from big egg producers, and I’ve got a bill that would tackle price gouging head-on.
https://t.co/Yg73JdTGrw

Passing a wealth tax.
Making child care affordable.
Ensuring the right to an abortion.
Putting stricter rules on banks so they don’t crash and hurt working people.

We’ve got more to accomplish, and I’m running for re-election to keep fighting for families.

I’m running for re-election to keep fighting for Massachusetts. Let’s protect our coastal communities from the climate crisis. Let’s build a 21st-century transportation system across our Commonwealth. Let’s put child care within reach for all of our families. Let’s get it done.

We’ve seen the powerful forces against us. But here’s the thing: the past ten years have shown us that when we organize, take on tough odds, and hold those in power accountable, we can make positive change.

Imagine an America where #MedicareForAll ensures health care is a basic human right. Imagine an America where you could get your prescriptions filled, without worrying about the cost. #Warren2020
Imagine fleeing violence and oppression and finding an America that matches our best values every day and welcomes asylum seekers and refugees with care and compassion. #Warren2020

Imagine a country where every young adult is treated as so valuable to all of us that technical school, two-year college, or four-year college is tuition-free and ready to welcome every one of them. #Warren2020

Imagine a country where every child is treated as so valuable to all of us that their education is a top priority. Imagine a country where teachers are deeply respected for the work they do—and paid accordingly. #Warren2020

If you were no longer stretched to make ends meet, who would you be? A coach? A volunteer? A parent? And if you could make these changes, what opportunities would it open up, for you? For your children? For your grandchildren? #Warren2020

If you were no longer paying half your income in rent, what could you do? Pay off your credit cards? Put money in a savings account? Get a dog? (That idea came from Bailey—but think about it.) #Warren2020
If you were no longer tied to your job in order to pay off student loan debt, where would you go? Try a different job? Move back to your hometown? Start your own business? #Warren2020

Imagine how you could thrive if America was safe for everyone. If you lived in a community without fear—without fear of oppression, of violence, of anti-semitism, white supremacy, and police brutality—how would you live your life? #Warren2020
Imagine what our country could mean for you. Imagine who you could be if America worked for everyone. #Warren2020
My determination to lead a movement has been forged by the tens of thousands of people who have said they are ready to fight for the country they know we can be. #Warren2020
My will to fight has been strengthened by the people who have whispered their dreams into my ear. #Warren2020
My plans for this country have been influenced by letters pressed into my palm by little girls. #Warren2020
One year into this campaign, you’ve never found me behind closed doors with corporate executives or spending hours on the phone sucking up to rich donors to fund my campaign. #Warren2020

Over the past year I’ve had the chance to shake hands or hug nearly 100,000 people in more than 180 town halls across the country. We have many differences—but we are ready to fight side-by-side for our common aspirations. #Warren2020

Exactly a year ago today, I got in the race for president. And I made the decision to run a campaign straight from the heart. I am deeply grateful that so many of you have put your full hearts into this campaign, as well. #Warren2020
On day one, we will start to make big, structural change to end the rigged economy and to create a new set of rules—rules that give everyone a chance to succeed. #Warren2020
On day one, we will start to make big, structural change to put the people in charge of our democracy—so we hear everyone’s voice and count everyone’s vote. #Warren2020

When I am president, we will attack corruption in Washington head-on. We will attack the concentration of power that makes this government work great for the wealthy and well-connected, and not for much of anyone else. #Warren2020
We come together to imagine this reality because this reality is now within our reach. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where big drug companies and the insurance industry don’t stand between Americans and the basic health care they need. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where the NRA and gun industry don’t get to put their own profits above the safety of our children. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where private prisons and detention centers don’t exist and no one makes a profit from locking people up. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where the fossil fuel industry doesn’t have a grip on our planet. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where the decisions made in Washington aren’t simply bought and paid for by lobbyists and big donors. #Warren2020
Taking the time to see ourselves and our world better than they are today sparks urgency in our hearts and determination in our minds. #Warren2020
Imagining alone won’t be enough. But imagination is powerful. It forces us to contemplate change in our lives; to begin to expect change. #Warren2020

So, just for a moment, here on the eve of a new year, let us come together to imagine. Imagine what our country will look like—imagine what your own life will look like—when we finally turn this page in our history. #Warren2020

Our greatest achievements were not born of fear. They were born of boldness and big dreams—of our unique ability to imagine a better world so clearly and thoroughly that we fought for it with everything we had, and turned things we could only imagine into reality. #Warren2020

We became the world’s leading industrial producer and simultaneously gave workers the right to join unions and live decent lives. We created breakthroughs in science and technology and connected the world through the internet. We rocketed to the moon. #Warren2020
Americans do big things. That’s who we are. And our best moments as a country have been when we see a challenge clearly and we mobilize to meet it head-on. #Warren2020
We are a nation that fights back. Fighting back is an act of patriotism. #Warren2020

As we turn the page tomorrow—into an election year and a new decade—there is a chill of fear in the air. People are afraid, and the danger they feel is real. Our democracy hangs in the balance. And now it comes to us—now it comes to us to fight back. #Warren2020

House Democrats upheld their sworn duty and impeached the president. Soon, I will return to the Senate to do mine as well. But unless some Senate Republicans choose truth over politics, Donald Trump will be emboldened to try to cheat his way through another election. #Warren2020

In the past 12 months, the president has become bolder with his lies and law-breaking. He tried to squeeze a foreign government to advance his own personal fortunes. Meanwhile, Republicans in Congress have turned into fawning, spineless defenders of his crimes. #Warren2020

In a few hours, the dawn of a new year will break over America, offering us a moment for pause and reflection. It is normally a moment for optimism. But let’s face it—this year in America has been anything but normal. #Warren2020

More than 50 years ago, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. went to Montgomery and warned us about the danger of division. That playbook has been around forever. The rich and powerful use fear to divide us.
 
We’re done with that. Bigotry has no place in the Oval Office.

I believe real democracy requires equal justice under law. 

It’s not equal justice when African Americans are more likely than whites to be arrested, more likely to be charged, more likely to be convicted, and more likely to be sentenced.

No more.

Let’s be clear: I won't take a dime of PAC money in this campaign. I won't take a single check from a federal lobbyist, or billionaires who want to run a Super PAC on my behalf. 
 
And I challenge every other candidate who asks for your vote in this primary to do the same.

Our fight is to change the rules so that our government works for everyone. That means:
 
✔️A #GreenNewDeal
✔️Fair housing
✔️#MedicareForAll
✔️Affordable childcare
✔️Student loan relief
✔️Overturning Citizens United

Time to change the rules to put more economic power in the hands of the American people – workers and small businesses. We need to put power back in the hands of workers, and take on Wall Street so that the big banks can never again threaten the security of our economy. https://t.co/6tiWVTopwb

America’s middle class has been deliberately hollowed out. The richest, most powerful people in America lobbied Washington and paid off politicians to tilt the system. And year by year, bit by bit, more of the wealth and opportunity went to the people at the very top.

I grew up in Oklahoma, on the ragged edge of the middle class. When my daddy had a heart attack, my family nearly tumbled over the financial cliff.
 
But we didn’t. My mother’s minimum-wage job answering phones at Sears saved our house, and saved our family.

This is the fight of our lives. The fight to build an America where dreams are possible, an America that works for everyone. I am in that fight all the way.

And that is why I’m in Lawrence, MA today: to declare that I am a candidate for President of the United States of America.
